sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is associative.
message_2:
To find (A Δ B) Δ C, we first need to find the symmetric difference (Δ) between sets A and B, and then find the symmetric difference between the result and set C.

The symmetric difference between two sets is the set of elements which are in either of the sets but not in their intersection. 

A Δ B = (A ∪ B) - (A ∩ B)

A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4} (union of A and B)
A ∩ B = {2, 3} (intersection of A and B)

A Δ B = {1, 2, 3, 4} - {2, 3} = {1, 4}

Now, we need to find the symmetric difference between (A Δ B) and C:

(A Δ B) Δ C = ({1, 4} ∪ C) - ({1, 4} ∩ C)

{1, 4} ∪ C = {1, 3, 4, 5} (union of {1, 4} and C)
{1, 4} ∩ C = {} (intersection of {1, 4} and C, which is an empty set)

(A Δ B) Δ C = {1, 3, 4, 5} - {} = {1, 3, 4, 5}

So, (A Δ B) Δ C = {1, 3, 4, 5}.
